intro: Marumia bancana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Marumia bancana is popular in horticulture for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
